getPorts().Description: Get the Port attribute. It restricts the ports to which a cookie may be returned in a Cookie request header.

Returns: true if this cookie should only be sent over secure connections, false otherwise.
isSecure().Description: Indicates whether this cookie requires a secure connection.

getComment().Description: Returns the comment describing the purpose of this cookie, or

getVersion().Description: Returns the version of the cookie specification to which this cookie conforms.

Returns: the value of the domain attribute
getDomain().Description: Returns domain attribute of the cookie.

getExpiryDate().Description: Returns the expiration @B_java#util#Date_E@ of the cookie, or

Returns: true if the cookie has expired.
isExpired(java.util.Date).Description: Returns true if this cookie has expired.

getCommentURL().Description: If a user agent (web browser) presents this cookie to a user, the cookie's purpose will be described by the information at this URL.

Returns: The value of the path attribute.
getPath().Description: Returns the path attribute of the cookie

Returns: false if the cookie should be discarded at the end of the "session"; true otherwise

ClassDesc: Please use @B_java#net#URL#openConnection_E@ instead. Please visit HTTP "magic-cookie" represents a piece of state information that the HTTP agent and the target server can exchange to maintain a session.
